basics.name: Nick Godshall
basics.label: Multidisciplinary Engineer
basics.summary: Multidisciplinary engineer with experience in backend development, AI systems, and model-based systems engineering. I’ve led work on LLM-powered tools like MAPPy, integrating Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines and deploying to secure environments like NASA’s AWS GovCloud.

work.name: Booz Allen Hamilton
work.summary: Lead Backend Developer for MAPPy, an LLM-powered platform for NASA and DoD. Built RAG pipelines, deployed to AWS GovCloud, and collaborated with clients like NASA JSC and NSWC Crane.
highlights: Designed ASGI backend interfacing with LLMs
Led secure Dockerized deployments to STIG-compliant infrastructure
Presented MAPPy use cases to stakeholders at NASA and DoD facilities

work.name: Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL)
work.summary: Supported publication of planetary datasets to the PDS by collaborating with the Atmospheres Node and planetary scientists.
highlights: Processed both ground-based and spacecraft observations of Jupiter
Ensured PDS compliance and metadata accuracy
Worked closely with atmospheric scientists and data archivists

awards.title: Graduated Summa Cum Laude
awards.summary: Awarded for graduating with high academic distinction.

projects.name: In Search of the Most Exciting Baseball Game
projects.summary: A tool that scraped and scored all 2,430 MLB games from 2023 based on a custom excitement metric.

projects.name: USB Nugget
projects.summary: Open-source cybersecurity tool for education and hacking.

projects.name: Digitally Igniting Fireworks
projects.summary: Designed a Wi-Fi controlled fireworks ignition system using ESP-32 and NiChrome wire.
